item.title: Report X-2024100256
item.description:
Report X-2024100256

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-25
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A spill agent at the HNBA location was presented two plastic Fedex packs suspected to contained spray paint cans. While investigating the shipments the spill agent found a single can of sprat paint in each pack. The shipments didn't have any DG markings or paperwork needed for shipment. They were placed into steel salvage packages and are being held at the location.

item.title: Report E-2024100047
item.description:
Report E-2024100047

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T12:22:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-23
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) quarts of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to improper loading. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel properly cleaned the impacted area and containerized the cleanup debris into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail and the damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 65-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
